text: A SWORD flashes in the sunlight as it whirls down on... SIR BOWEN...a ruggedly handsome knight who catches the bl on his own, just inches from his face, and smiles through crossed swords, eyes gleaming like the sunlit steel.
Not bad! He disengages his blade with swift flare and, in a dazzli series of sallies, forces his OPPONENT back.
But not good enough to... The opponent, BACK TO CAMERA, is shoved to the ground, Bowen's sword tip at his throat.

«+-to live! Bowen grins down at... PRINCE EINON...a fourteen year old boy, his face flush fr exertion. Emblazoned on his surcote is a DRAGON'S HEAD impaled on a sword. A HERALDIC COAT-OF-ARMS. Suddenly, Einon kicks Bowen's blade aside with his boot, rolls, and springs up, lunging at the knight. Again, Bowe deflects the blade by inches. Smiling. Pleased.

Better! Einon is also pleased. He smiles at Bowen's praise and le down his guard. Just slightly. But enough. With a nimble parry, Bowen blade arcs down, striking the startled boy.. only with the flat of the blade on his shoulder.
But you'd still be dead! Einon reels back and, with a snarl, charges wildly at Bow who, laughing, leaps upon a crumbling piece of stone, eas deflecting or ducking the violent but clumsy blows.
Purpose, not passion, Einon! Fight with your head, not your heart!  He punctuates each maxim with a slap of his sword flat, obviously toying with the boy.

Nerve cold-blue, blade blood-red. Einon slices wickedly at Bowen's legs. Bowen leaps up as blade swishes harmlessly under him. But as he lands, the edge of the stone crumbles beneath the heel of his boot. teeters, then tumbles off the rock, out of sight behind i Einon's savage fighting demeanour slides into a shocked g of concern.

Sir Bowen? He scrambles over the stone to find Bowen sprawled out on ground, apparently unconscious. As Einon leans down to examine him, he's suddenly distracted by HOOFBEATS. He whirls to the sound as... RIDERS...gallop toward them. As Einon squints in the sun identify them, A FIGURE towers up behind him and a sword glints at his throat. Bowen leers over his shoulder.
Dead again, Prince! How many times must I tell you?
(reciting together) Only expose your back to a corpse! But the fencing lesson is over. Einon points to the rider
It's happened. Bowen scowls as Three Riders approach, led by A MASSIVE B OF A KNIGHT...SIR BROK...Einon knows why he's come.
The peasants are revolting.
(grins) They've always been revolting, Prince. Smell one sometime. But now they're rebelling. (to Bowen) King Freyne would have his son witness his noble victory.
(contemptuous1ly) Noble...? Crushing desperate, frightened men...?

(sharply) Traitorous scum! The King commands. Bring him. You can watch too, nursemaid. He whips his horse and rides off with the others. Bowen turns to get his and Einon's horses. . Einon is disappoin that Bowen allowed Brok's insult to go unchallenged.
Why do you let him insult you like that? You, a Knight of the Old Code! You're not afraid of him!

(laughs) Nor his opinions. I expect no less. (distaste) He's the king's man. Einon registers Bowen's contempt for the king with an une scowl, but as Bowen turns to hand him his reins, the boy beams affectionately at him.
When I am king, you will be my man, Bowen. Bowen claps him warmly on the shoulder and helps the prin into the saddle.
I am already your man, my prince. He swings into the saddle and, as the two ride after Brok CAMERA PANS TO THE GALLOPING HOOVES.

head_text.subj: CAMERA PULLS BACK FROM MANY MORE GALLOPING HOOVES TO REVE

text: A TROOP OF MOUNTED, ARMOURED KNIGHTS...as they ride out o the smoke and dust of battle. At their head is... KING FREYNE...sword aloft. Visor raised. Eyes hard and hateful. On his helmet glints a GOLD CIRCLET. A CROWN. Emblazoned on his surcote is the same DRAGON’S HEAD impal on a sword we saw on Einon's surcote. He rides through the carnage of a 10th CENTURY BATTLE, leading mounted SOLDIERS against a RABBLE OF PEASANTS. Slashing with mad glee, Freyne mows down men armed only w crude farm implements. It is slaughter as the rebels are driven back through their own crude lines of defense...ov turned carts, ditches, an earthen bulwark. None of which impede Freyne's onslaught.
Bowen and Einon sit their horses on a hillock behind the lines watching the carnage. Bowen is disgusted, Einon fascinated.
I wish we were down there.
(curtly) You don't.
Ido. Just to see you in action, Bowen. Yours would be the finest blade on the field.
Too fine to foul with your father's slaughter. In a quiet, hurt tone, Einon gently reminds Bowen of good manners and protocol.
He is my father, Bowen. And the king. Bowen takes the admonishment with a kind smile.

Yes...But when you are king, remember today. Remember the difference between battle and butchery. And remember the Qld Code. Restore its forgotten glory, so that the crown will shine with honour once more and never again will men have to take up arms against their sovereign. Then you will be a greater king than your father. Bowen turns to watch the ungallant battle with weary eyes thus doesn't see the dark glint in Einon's gaze,

I promise, Bowen, I will be greater. And no one will take arms against me...Look! Father's breached the village. He points to the king down below, galloping toward the bulwark, cutting down men right and left.

Freyne descends on a YOUTH -- wearing a BUCKET with one s cut out as a crude helmet -~ who stumbles between two HAYRACKS mounted in a gap in the bulwark. A large meaty paw reaches out and grabs BUCKETHEAD by th jerkin, yanking the youth behind... THE BULWARK...Buckethead flops into a LARGE MUD PUDDLE on other side. Buckethead's saviour is a RED-BEARDED GIANT, whose unruly mane is bound by a LEATHER HEAD-BAND. Armed with a scythe, Red-beard knocks the sword from Frey hand as the king rides in through the breach. Another reb charges the king with a burning torch, but gets a gauntle the face as Freyne punches him and snatches his torch. He whirls his steed back for the bulwark. But Red-beard signals several men at the hayracks, who pu SPIKED WOODEN BREASTWORKS out from under the racks and cu off Freyne's escape route.

Bowen and Einon watch from their vantage point as a HORDE VILLAGERS chase the trapped Freyne. Freyne zig-zags his horse in and out and under the stilts of SEVERAL RAISED GRAINHOUSES, torching some as he passes. But the peasants are closing in.
(anxiously) He's trapped! The boy draws his sword and spurs his horse down the hill through the melee!
Einon, no! He follows after the boy.

Bowen closes in on his young charge when he's beset by RE WARRIORS. He ducks the savage thrust of a pitchfork and, grabbing the shaft, cracks the WIELDER under the jaw with blunt end. Another rebel gets clouted by Bowen's boot eve as the knight knocks another down with the shaft of the pitchfork. He kills no one. But even as he scatters them, he's lost Einon in the dusty haze of the battle. He shout
Einon!

Red-beard and a MOTLEY BAND OF REBELS close in on Freyne, king's horse snorts and rears as Freyne whirls his torch, trying to pry an opening through the rebel mass. But they catch him under one of the granaries and pull h from the saddle. Freyne clanks to the ground in a cacopho of armour and chainmail. at the feet of... BUCKETHEAD...who's shoved aside again as Redbeard and the others crowd around the fallen king. Crude weapons rise a fall. Buckethead jerks away, unable to watch. Then it's over as RED-BEARD and the others race to defend their village from Freyne's men who have breach the barricade. Only Buckethead remains, queasily staring at t dead king. A WILD WAIL pierces the battle clamour.

Father! -Buckethead swiftly clambers up the granary ladder as... EINON...gallops through a veil of smoke over the bulwark. Dismounting, he scrambles to his father, laying a hand to lifeless breast... and pulling it back with a shudder, covered in blood. Stunned, Einon stares from his hand to his father and then...to the crown...perched atop Freyne's helmet. Trembling, he reaches over the body for it. As he does, Freyne's eyes suddenly FLICKER OPEN AND STARE into Einon' who hesitates...then snatches the crown off anyway...even Freyne groans his last and his eyes glaze in deathly admonishment at his heir.

As Einon pulls back from his dead father, he holds up the crown. It glints brilliantly in the firelight. Something else also glints. Buckethead's KNIFE as Einon sees the flying body leap off the granary platform down onto him. The impact of their collision sends the boys sprawling ac the ground spilling against a breastwork, a jumble of arm and legs. The bucket helmet clatters off as the rebel flo face-down, a cascade of red hair falling toe his shoulder Einon lurches off the breastwork, grasping a STAKE for support. It is sticky with BLOOD. His blood. It oozes fro a gash in his chest, spilling across his ripped dragonhea crest. Einon spies the CROWN half-in, half-out of a mud puddle. weaves toward it on unsteady legs, then sags into the mud his fingers locking on the circlet. Gasping weakly, he st glassy-eyed at Buckethead, staggering up. Even unhelmeted, Buckethead's face is A BLUR in Einon's h vision. All he sees is flaming hair, blending into the fi light of a hut burning behind then.

Einon! Einon's vision pops into crystal clear FOCUS as Buckethe whirls to the anguished CRY...and we discover THE BOY IS GIRL!. Her name is...as we later learn...KARA. She's roughly Einon's age and even the grime of battle cannot h her beauty, haloed in an aureole of gleaming red hair. As Kara sees Bowen's steed leap over the breastworks and Bowen wildly spins the horse toward the fallen Einon, lea down in the saddle and scooping up his wounded charge.
Bowen!

I'm here, my prince...my king. He whirls his horse back around and, sideswiping, a BARRE OF MILK, bounds over the barricade once more. Kara dives of the way, landing near the spilt milk now running into mixing with the blood of battle.
Einon slumps back in Bowen's arms as the horse charges through the battlefield.
A WOODEN FORTRESS looms out of the shadow of a mountain. Grimly impressive. Bowen's steed breaks from the forest a races across the plain toward the Fortress gates.
A wounded Brok kneels before AISLINN, the Queen.

Dead, Madam...King Freyne, your husband, slain. She takes the news stoically, staring out the window in impassive resignation. A DOOR slams open. Aislinn spins t the sound. Silhouetted in the light of the open door stan a KNIGHT, A LIMP FORM CRADLED IN HIS ARMS. With a gut-sinking premonition, Aislinn weaves to the doo A single TEAR trickles muddily down Bowen's grimey face a Aislinn gasps at her crumpled son.
Forgive me, my Queen.
It's not your fault. The cruel excesses of his father brought him to this end. She gestures to a bed. Bowen lays him on it.
The crown...
He lives!
He dies, Madan... Bowen slides the crown off his arm and places it in the b vhand.
«+.Beyond all help.
Not all... Aislinn turns to Bowen...curiously calm even hopeful.
The sun sinks behind a promontory as FIGURES trek through RUINS OF AN OLD CASTLE up the mountain.

Aislinn, on horseback, leads Bowen and a body of GUARDS u mountain path, through the RUINS OF AN ANCIENT ROMAN CAST Brok and the others bear Einon on a hide stretcher suppor on spears. Walking his horse, Bowen hovers over the semi- conscious boy who still grips the crown and talks to him.
(reciting) A knight is sworn to valour...
+«.sworn... to valour...
His heart knows only virtue...
.--virtue...

His blade defends the helpless. His might upholds the weak... Bowen is suddenly distracted by an EERIE MUSICAL TRILLIN Sad and melancholy. It comes from further up the mountain The others hear it as well. Except for Einon whose mumble drifts to a groan. Bowen shakes him.
You must stay awake, my lord. You must! Recite the code...
-.-code...
Yes! His might upholds the weak...
-.-his...word speaks only truth...
Yes... yes... His wrath...?
(reciting together) His wrath undoes the wicked.
Night has descended. The moon glows a bright scarlet. The party stops before a CAVE, lighting torches. Bowen dismou and gathers Einon off the stretcher into his arms.
Aislinn takes a torch and starts into the cave. From with echoes the mournful, musical TRILL. Bowen eyes her warily
I know what place this is. It has the stink of dragon.
Not the Dragon's stench; merely man's pollution of him. Come and fear not! Aislinn enters. Bowen, Einon in his arms, hesitantly follows.

Even torchlight cannot dispel the gloom. Their light and shafts of scarlet moonlight, seeping through two holes in cavern roof, illuminate bubbling mud pits and bones. Stea wreathes through the place. From the cave's recesses come faint IRRIDESCENT RIPPLE OF MOVEMENT. And the melancholy TRILL. Toward this Aislinn cautiously, humbly, approaches  10
Lord! Serene One! Her voice echoes. The TRILLING stops. The Guards murmur uneasily. Bowen warily eyes The GLOW. It seems BRIGHTER. Defining an UNCERTAIN SHAPE. Aislinn signals for silence.
Your song is sad tonight.
There are no stars in the sky? The VOICE...sad yet strangely soothing... comes from the large, eerie shape shimmering in the shadows. It, too, is large and eerie. Aislinn moves to the glow.

No...only a moon. Blood-red. Bowen eases Einon down. Hovering protectively over him, suspiciously listening, his eye never leaving the creatur the shadows. The peculiar irridescence is the beast's sca hide that emits a wavering glow as he shifts.
Aislinn. Daughter of Athelstun.
Yes, Lord, whose people loved you and called your kind friend.
Once. Long ago. No more. No longer fickle man's friend. Feared. Forgotten.

I have not forgotten. I do not fear. Einon sighs. Aislinn kneels beside Bowen to comfort her s stroking his brow, as the boy feverishly fondles the crow The Dragon's half~hooded eye glints from the darkness, surveying the prince. The crown caressed in his hands.
Freyne's child. Aislinn desperately whirls on the dragon.
Is this why you come, Draonslayer's wife?  il

Dragonslayer's widow! A bride of conquest! My people driven out and slaughtered even as yours. (kneels) Please! He's not his father. (points to Bowen) This knight is his mentor. He has taught him the Old Code. And I will teach him your ways. The dragon's scales brightly ripple. He considers her ple his baleful eye falling on the boy's bloody breast.
The wound is deep. You know what you ask?
(kneels before him) I swear. He will grow in your grace. Grow just and good. The dragon's shadowy head inclines toward Einon.

He must swear. Your sword, knight. Aislinn nods to Bowen. He reluctantly unsheathes it to ha to her, but the Dragon's CLAW emerges from the dark and g the blade in his talons. Bowen instinctively lets go. The dragon extends the hilt to Einon who stirs and, seein the shadowy creature above, gasps.
Fear not, child, he will save you.

But first, boy, by the cross of the sword, swear that your Father's bloodlust and tyranny die with him. Swear that you will live and rule with mercy. And come to me and learn. The Once-ways. Swear! "Swear, swear, swear..." his sibilance echoes through the darkness. Einon clutches the sword to his breast.
I...swear... Einon leans up to kiss the pommel, then suddenly slumps i Bowen's arms. Bowen shakes him.
Einon? Einon! He's dead!  12 In angry grief, Bowen grabs the sword hilt to wrest it fr the Dragon. But as he yanks, the Dragon's TALONS SCRAPE D

head_text.subj: THE LENGTH OF THE BLADE WITH A WHINING SCREECH, SCORING A
GROOVE INTO IT FROM GUARD TO TIP.

text: Peace, Knight of the Old Code... The Dragon suddenly blows out the torches, immersing them darkness. Save for the occasional glint of his shimmering scales and his glowing eyes.

-».And witness the wonders of an even more ancient glory. The Dragon releases the sword and places a talon against breast, IMPALING it in the scales of his hide. As he slic down his chest, a RED GLOW issues from the wound. Not blo but LIGHT. The dragon reaches into the cut. Sighs. Groans And captures a PULSATING SCARLET BRILLIANCE in his claw, the wound closes over. He holds the glowing orb over the boy. Einon's eyelids flutter open. He smiles, as the beast gently reaches down and the glowing redness seeps into Einon's wound.

Half my heart to make you whole. It's strength to purify your weakness. Live and remember your oath. He pulls his claw back and a THIN SLIVER OF FIRE shoots f the Dragon's nostril along the wound, cauterizing it. But Einon feels no pain. He smiles and his eyelids grow heavy and flutter down. Einon sleeps peacefully. Aislinn gasps joyous sob and hugs the sleeping boy. Bowen is dumbfounde Once more FLAME sprays from the Dragon, relighting the terches, Aislinn rises and bows to the Dragon. She turns, Bowen lifts Einon up in his arms, and, with their entoura they turn to leave. Bowen hesitates and turns to the drag

I've served the father only for the sake of the son. In him go all the hopes of my heart. Forgive a doubting fool. Call when you've need of me, ask what you will of me. My sword and service are yours. The dragon has faded into the darkness. Only an occasiona shiny scale flickers.
Only remind him always of his vow, Knight of the Old Code.  13

Bowen, on horseback, leads Aislinn's steed down the mount through the Roman ruins once more. Behind them comes Brok and the guard with... EINON. ..asleep on his stretcher, unconsciously fondling crown in his hands. The crown slips from his fingers, clanking to the ground. Einon jerks awake, sitting up bolt straight. A strange, fierce light in his eyes. He's tense with coiled energy. Brok signals the guard to halt and kneels beside Einon.
Your Majesty? Is all well? Einon unconsciously feels the scar on his chest. Einon ga at it, remembering. The Dragon. He smiles at the memory.
All is very well. The crown. Brok picks it up and offers it to Einon. Eyes afire, Eino takes the crown and firmly plants it on his head. He like the fit.
Anything more, Your Majesty? Einon turns from his regal reverie to smile grimly at Bro
Much more. He rises off the stretcher. Brok goes to support him, but Einon pushes him away. He's a little rocky on his feet, b he stands, staring out on the Roman ruins.
The Romans built a great castle here. Mine will be greater.
It will take many men, milord, to rebuilt this ruin.
Yes...

THE SOLDIERS OF THE KING swarm through the burnt ruin of village. WAILING WOMEN and even SOME CHILDREN have been p to work filling in the barricade ditch, THE VILLAGE MENFO are being rounded up from hiding places and shackled in WOODEN NECK STOCKS.  14 BROK, in charge of this foray, steers his horse through t trampled shambles of a hut and scrapes away debris with h sword, ferreting out a TRAPDOOR beneath the charred clutt He motions to TWO SOLDIERS who jerk open the door, exposi dishevelled REDBEARD hiding below in a root cellar full o cheese. Brok's sword jabs downward. Into a ROUND OF CHEESE. As Br takes a bite of the cheese, Redbeard is yanked out and he toward the other prisoners. Kara, working at the ditch, drops her spade and rushes to him.
Father! Tears in her eyes, she clings to him, but Brok yanks her ‘roughly by the hair and shoves her away. She falls to th ground, rising up to see REDBEARD yoked into a stock with other prisoners.

Firelight flickers over Einon's face. He sits his horse, next to a SMITHY'S FIRE, savouring the SOUNDS OF CLINKING CHAINS AND SPLINTERED STONE, as he gazes out over... A STONE QUARRY...FETTERED PEASANTS break rocks under the watchful eyes of ARMED GUARDS. Einon watches in malevolen satisfaction as Brok rides in with a half dozen more QUAR SLAVES harnessed together with a length of rope about the neck. Among them is REDBEARD.

Hold, Brok! Brok stops his charges with a rough jerk on the rope. Ein appraisies Redbeard suspiciously. Even in defeat, the big man stares up at the new king with cold contempt. Einon cannot match his stern gaze. Redbeard smiles.
Come to thank me, boy? You should. It was my stroke that made you king. Brok yanks Redbeard's head back by his headband, exposing neck to his blade.
My stoke will make you a corpse!
No! The command halts the throat-slitting. Einon glares at Redbeard glaring at him.  15
I want no martyrs. And death is a release, not punishment. Einon smiles evilly at Redbeard whose glare hardens but a flickers with faint worry.

It's an insolent gaze. Look good, dog. And remember. I am your king. The one who crushed you. And the last thing you will ever see. Einon grabs an iron from the smithy's fire. Its tip is white-hot. He flings it to Brok.

Burn that insolence out of his eyes! Grinning, Brok picks up the iron. Redbeard, pale but prou gazes up into the rocks. He shakes his head from side-to- side, almost imperceptibly. To anyone observing, it would merely seem dazed defiance or maybe trembling fear, but i is, in actuality a signal. A signal to... KARA...hidden up behind a boulder. Redbeard is warning th girl to stay put. Stay safe. Weeping, Kara obeys as... BROK...approaches Readbeard, head still high. Eyes still the rocks above. But as Brok raises the iron a SWORD BLAD swoops down and strikes it from his hand. It is... BOWEN'S SWORD...as he gallops past Brok to the prisoners, blade slicing the ropes binding them together.

Run! No encouragement needed, the prisoners scatter for the forest. Bowen's whirlwind appearance confuses Einon's men But one snaps out of it and tries to stop an escapee. Bow comes between them and cuts the soldier down. Meanwhile.. KARA...scrambles out of the rocks and, in the confusion, rushes down to Redbeard.
Father!

Kara! Quickly! Einon spots the girl and charges after them, but once mor Bowen rides between the pursuer and the pursued, who duck into the woods. Enraged, Einon bears down on Bowen with d sword. Bowen reluctantly but skillfully defends himself against the attack.
How dare you defy me!
Einon! You're unwell! Bewitched! (pleading) Don't do this! Remember the code!

The king is above the code! Dismayed by this declaration, Bowen drops his guard and E unseats him with a stab in the shoulder. The knight toppl from his mount, falling between the skittish horses. Eino rides over him, whirling triumphantly to acknowledge the cheers of his men. His mistake...for... A MUDDY HAND...reaches up and yanks Einon's leg from the stirrup, shoving it out and up, heaving.... EINON...off his horse. The boy reels over the right flank his horse, flopping to the ground to find... BOWEN...grimly grinning at him through the legs of the ho

Only expose your back to a corpse. You forget everything I've taught you! Bowen, braced on his blade, bleeding from his shoulder an his head, tries to stagger up. Einon angrily leaps up and, whipping his horse away, lung at Bowen, still on his knees. But even kneeling, Bowen deflects Einon's wild charge.

Control, little warrior! His blade knocks Einon's aside, then rips across the drag crest on the surcote. Bowen, still on his knees, counters Einon's fierce but undisciplined, crazed sallies, critiqu the boy's technique as he does.

Purpose, not passion, Einon. Fight with your head... He slashes Einon's belt. It slides down his legs and trip him up. He lugges savagely atop the tottering Einon, forc him down, poistng his sword tip on the boy's heart.

».-not your heart.  17 The heart. His eyes smoldering with pained hurt, Bowen spies the torn dragon on the surcote, which rises and fal along with his blade, in chaotic rhythm to Einon's racing heart. The dragon's heart. The dragon. It's almost as though he can hear the cursed heart beating. Thump. Thump Thump. Pulsing with treacherous life. With a mad, griefstricken wail, Bowen raises his sword... jabs it in the ground beside Einon's head, staring at the with sorrow-filled eyes. His voice rasps with choked emotion.

No one is above the code. Least of all, a king! ‘He leans down and kisses the boy. Tears well in his eyes he whirls up and sharply whistles. As Bowen's steed gallo up, Einon scrambles away, grasping his cheek where Bowen kissed him. His confused fear quickly turns to anger once more as Bowen mounts and spurs his steed off into the for
Seize him! Bring him down!
Bowen gallops off through the sun-streaked trees. THE CAM
KARA & REDBEARD..-.hiding in a tree, as Einon and his min ride in pursuit of Bowen.

Bowen emerges from the dragon cave. In frustrated fury, h clangs his drawn sword against the rock. His horse whinni nervously, as the shrieking clang echoes out over the mountains where a shimmering half-orb of SUNLIGHT splays across a purple-orange sky.

No matter where you fly, Dragon, no matter where you hide, I will find you! My oath will not save you! All bonds are broke by your betrayal. I make a new vow! I will undo your treachery!...Even if I must spend the rest of my life hunting you and your kind down! In the distance, Bowen's echoing oath is answered by A MOURNFUL TRILL...Every mountain seems to reverberate with tortured KEENING as the CAMERA PULLS BACK, capturing Bowe the golden flood of the sinking sun. WE HEAR A VOICE.  18
This is the tale of a Knight who slew a Dragon and vanquished Evil. GOLDEN LIGHT overwhelms the screen as a SUPERIMPOSED LEGE
The GOLDEN LIGHT becomes... WHEAT...waving gently in the morning breeze. Behind the w of grain comes a VOICE...the same we just heard...recitin

(reciting) "A solitary pilgrim rode Upon his lowly mule,..." CAMERA PANS over the rolling hill of wheat, finding... FRIAR GILBERT...a monk...riding a MULE on a path between wheatfields. Both mule and monk are laden with scrolls and manuscripts Bundles of parchment protrude from the saddlebags. Slung about the monk's middle is a clothsack filled with scroll As Gilbert recites, he scratches a quill across a scroll unrolled against the mule's neck.
(writing) "Content with this his humble mode, His quest was spiritual..." Except it comes out"spirichool" as he tries to rhyme it w mule. The mule itself begins to buck.

Whoa, Merlin! Whooaa! But Merlin doesn't "whoa" and bucks Gilbert off, who tumb cassock over crucifix, the scrolls from his pouch spillin out on the ground with him.. He sits up with as much dign as he can muster and glares at the mule.

Everyone's a critic. But the mule's only response is to bray nervously and sto impatiently at the ground. Ignoring the tempermental anim Gilbert crawls about gathering up his scrolls, grumbling himself.  19

Keep faith, Gilbert, keep faith! True, thus far, this quest has been uneventful -.-if not altogether fruitless and boring +..But remember its goals, its glory! Soon, something's bound to happen. Something does. A SUDDEN WHOOSH OF WIND violently rustles wheat and tears at the monk's cassock. The just~gathered scrolls go flying from his grip once more and Gilbert goe flat on his back once more. His eyes widening with fear a they gaze upward, following the path of the wind.

D-D-Dragon! ‘The GUST OF WIND subsides and the RUSTLING OF WINGS whip away over a hill of wheat which wavers violently in its w Scrambling up, Gilbert scoops up precious scrolls as he t off for the opposite wheatfield. But he screeches to a panicked halt as SOMETHING ELSE charges out of the wheat. Wailing, the frenzied friar flings himself to the ground more in a welter of flying manuscripts.

(crosses himself) Jesu! Gilbert peeks up to see... A KNIGHT...reining in his horse, frowning down at him. It BOWEN. But Bowen is mightily changed since last we saw him. Time has passed and not been kind. His hair is now laced with grey. His face is unshaven. His surcote frayed and torn. His armour dented and dull. He and his steed are laden with assorted weaponry. Broad sword, lance, bow and arrows, mace, battle axe, and buckl This SHIELD gives grim evidence of his trade...and that h has been successful in his vow...an awesome assortment of DRAGON HORNS protrudes from it. Bowen snaps at the friar in curt irritation.
Dra...dra...drag...

Yes! Where? Gilbert gestures with a bent scroll clutched in his shaki hand. Bowen gives chase, he and his mount disappearing ov the hill of wheat.  20 A painful HOWL jerks the priest up, shivering. A BURST OF FIRE erupts in the sky from over the hill. The stalks qui in manic agitation. SOMETHING'S coming toward him! It's Bowen's riderless horse. Gilbert kneels in prayer. He's interrupted by ANOTHER HORRIBLE YOWL! Then... STILLNESS! Gilbert creeps to the wheat, listening. Nothin Then RUSTLING. Close by! A DRAGON HORN pokes through the stalks. Gilbert falls back with a yelp. It's only... BOWEN...holding a SEVERED DRAGON HORN. Bowen goes to his horse and begins to affix his latest tr to his shield. Gilbert scrambles to his feet and, pluckin up scattered scrolls along the way, rushes to the knight.

A guardpost BONFIRE burns brightly as Bowen approaches it carrying something in hand. It is his DRAGON-HORNED SHIEL He casts it into the flame. It burns furiously with an -almost SUPERNATURAL LIGHT...LIKE MAGNESIUM. Brilliant gl spark and flare off the burning horns.
Well done. Bowen turns to see Draco behind hin.
A knight of the Old Code needs no such adornment.
(agrees) No...It burns brightly.
Like a promise of hope.

No, Bowen, your hope lies down there. Draco nods to... THE VALLEY..-below. It is alive with the cookfires gleami in the twilight. We hear singing, children crying, laught All the sounds of life going on.
The one I've waited for. Man must now make of the world what he can...The day of dragons is done.
Not done for you. If we are victorious tomorrow, we'll have need of you.  90

You'll have victory, but no need of me. Listen to them, Knight of the Old Code, The Once-ways are in their songs and their laughter and the cries of their children. Listen and look. Draco's voice is strangely cryptic and wistful. Bowen loo at him in suspicious concern.
What do you see?
Everything. It yours now. His sad eyes turn once more to the bonfire and the bright burning dragon shield. Its glow becomes...

+.-The DRACO EMBLEM on Bowen's armour glinting gold in th sunlight. Tied to his arm is Kara's favour. He is at the head of his ARMY. Draco's image is also on the banners flapping gloriously in the morning breeze. IN SEVERAL SHOTS AND ANGLES, THE CAMERA CATCHES the motle but proudly determined army as it MARCHES out of camp. Ka and Gilbert ride by Bowen's side. Hewe, foot, marches at head of the troop with the other "GENERALS". Hewe glances up. Others follow his gaze as... DRACO...swoops overhead. He dips a wing in salute. BOWEN...acknowledges Draco's salute with a raised sword a the dragon banks left in the direction of Einon castle.
As they, too, raise their weapons in salute to the dragon whose SHADOW ripples over then,
A VOLLEY OF FIRE ARROWS SHOOT through the sky, bouncing harmlessly off the castle wall and sputtering out. CAMERA
A SMALL TROOP OF REBELS...shabby and pitiful, led by Bowe down in the field before the castle have fired the arrows

head_text.subj: MERE FRACTION OF THE REBEL FORCE. LAUGHTER RIPPLES DOWN F

text: (laughing) Seems you overestimated their numbers, Brok.

Einon, Brok, Felton and others observe the puny rebel for as another PATHETIC VOLLEY OF FIRE ARROWS plunk against t parapet wall. ONE ARROW actually makes it over the wall. Einon calmly reaches out and catches it in mid-air in his gauntletted hand. He blasely inspects it.
And twelve years hasn't improved their ain. Felton chuckles and smirks at Brok.
They'll get bored and go home before dark.

Why wait? We'll send you out to chase them off. After all, "One of us is worth a hundred of them." The numbers seem about right. Felton gulps uneasily as Einon wags the fire arrow in his face. But a worried Brok is unamused, ominously scanning sky.

There were more! And where's the...? Brok chokes on the question as the answer comes in view.. DRACO...suddenly flies out of the sunlight and, swooping down, sprays the battlements with fire, sending soldiers screaming and leaping to safety. As Einon and his general also dash for cover, they look up to see... DRACO...flying out of the smoke of the explosion.
In a field between the castle walls and the forest masses peasant army, BOWEN and HEWE at its head. The rebels chee as Draco rains more flame down on the denizens of the cas

THE DRAGONSLAYERS manuever a LARGE CATAPULT THAT SHOOTS HARPOONS into place, scanning the sky for...  92 DRACO...who suddenly swoops up from behind the castle wal surprising the Dragonslayers who abandon there catapult a Draco looses a firebomb at them. As the catapult swerves, Volney is knocked against the triggering mechanism, discharging the harpoon which goes flying and strikes... A STUNNED JUGURTHA...right through his chest, impaling hi the wall. His giant axe, still gripped in his hand, knock soldier off the battlements, sending him plummet ing to t ground at the feet of... EINON'S HORSE...the young king is mounted, at the head of armoured knights. The horse rears as Einon frowns at the soldier, then at the blazing catapult on the battlement.
Oh, lovely... He draws his sword and shouts to his men.

Well, do we stay in here like sitting ducks or crush those rebellious dogs? Brok leads a chorus of war-cries. And as the gates are opened, Einon and his mounted horse, followed by foot soldiers, pour out of the castle, watched by... AISLINN...from a tower window. Einon and his men rush the peasants who retreat for the forest. She glances up at... DRACO...hovering above, oblivious to the spears of the Dragonslayers, watching the peasants run...almost smiling
The peasants retreat without a blow being struck. Einon, spies Bowen in the rout. He laughs deliriously.
After them! Shear them like the sheep they are. And Einon and his riders give chase into the woods.

head_text.subj: BUT EINON HAS MADE A TACTICAL MISTAKE.

text: As soon as all the king's riders are wheeling admidst the trees, Bowen wheels his horse on a rise.

Now!  93 Behind Einon's calvary, A REBEL swings by on a rope out o tree, a FLAMING FAGGOT IN HIS HANDS. He dips the torch in TRENCH filled with PITCH. The fire runs across the forest and up both sides creating a U-shaped barrier boxing in t knights. The horses panic as the walls of flame rise around them. Then they descend... HUNDREDS OF PEASANTS...Bowen motions them forward with hi sword and they charge en masse. Panicked knights try to j their horses through the flames as pikemen pick knights o horses and the swordmen and axe-wielders fall upon them. CAMERA CLOSES IN ON EINON as he realizes his mistake but ‘assumes comand.

Scatter or die! Einon leaps his horse over the fire. Others follow his example as his force splits up in the forest and comes fa to-face with more rebel mischief. Barrages of arrows fly out of bushes and trees picking me off. More rebels lie in wait in the forest. The peasant assault is swift and surprising and deadly. A men are dvided and trapped, overwhelming numbers of rebel appear to finish them off in hand-to-hand combat. THE CAMERA PANS THROUGH THE MAYHEM... BROK...bashes through a phalanx of peasants with a mace a chain and encounters Hewe with his quarter staff. The two tangle it up. ELSEWHERE... GILBERT AND OTHER ARCHERS...perched in an archer blind wa THREE ARMED RIDERS charge a group of rebels. With lightni speed Gilbert notches an arrow and shoots. THE ARROW...strikes a TAUT ROPE tied off to a tree branch neatly slices it in two. The rope slides through the branches, releasing... A LOG...suspended overhead which comes crashing down in f of the three riders. Their horses rear up and the riders rock off their saddles. As they tumble to the ground, the rebels rush them. GILBERT...crosses himself.

Pride goeth before a fall, brother!  94 Meanwhile below... FELTON...sword in hand, helmetless, cowardly scurries fro tree to tree through the commotion, avoiding any fight he can. But as he creeps around the bole of a tree, a pitchf is thrust at his face. He jerks back and the tines of the fork embed in the tree trunk. Felton whirls face-to-face with... HIS MINX...she's gone over to the rebels! Felton's stunne rage gives him a sudden flash of courage.

You traitorous witch! After all, I've spent on... (catches himself) «.-done for...you! She sneers and tries to yank her pitchfork from the tree. But before she can, Felton, brave against a helpless woma snaps the shaft in two with his sword blade. The minx staggers back with the broken end. Felton advanc on her, but... GILBERT...has spotted them and looses an arrow from his b It pierces... FELTON...in the rear. Dropping his sword, he yelps in pai GILBERT...also yelps for joy.

Turn the other cheek! However, it is... THE MINX...who turns Felton's other cheek, by whacking hi the jaw with her broken shaft. The lamps go out in his ey and he crumples to the ground. Elsewhere... KARA...fights among a group of peasants and soldiers. Whirling her axe with expert skill she holds her ATTACKER also wielding an axe, at bay. But she is so busily engage she does not see the other two ENEMIES rushing up to help their companion. But.. BOWEN...riding across the field does. He gallops his hors between the two swordsmen and extending his legs, kicks b of them into the dirt as he rides by. He then leaps from his charging horse and rushes to Kara' side just as she neatly dispatches her adversary and grab his axe as he falls. Whirling both axes, she smiles over Bowen.  95
Like a pudding!

More pudding's coming. Kara's being rushed by two men. Bowen by three. One he quickly dispatches and takes his sword. He grips his two blades, Kara her two axes. Grinning grimly, shoulder-to- shoulder, they take on all-comers.

Volney the Tartar supervises the loading of hideous barbe GRAPPLING HOOKS into the bowls of THREE CATAPULTS, cranke ‘and ready. Draco streaks right to left directly overhead. Commanding the king's soldiers, Volney cranks the first lever.

Now! The catapults wang off in order, hurling their nasty load the dragon. But Draco is a skilled warrior. He sees the missiles comi and dodges them all. With his right hand, he catches the last hook and, yanking viciously, he does a barrel roll o of frame. Back on the platform, the BOLTS fastened to the catapult way like driven into balsa. The catapult skews sideways a wedges under two others. The force of Draco's pull rips u the whole mess SMASHING into Volney and the soldiers agai the stone walls, crushing them to death and taking out a piece of new masonry. Through a window arch below, Volney hangs upside down, his eyes sightless in death...
Out of the smoke and confusion rides... EINON...slicing through a band of rebels. The battle goes badly for him. He shouts above the fray.
Retreat! His men readily obey and scatter through the woods. He sp his horse and joins their flight.  96
Bowen and Kara are pressed back-to-back as Einon suddenly rides by. Both recognize him.

_Gilbert, stop him! Gilbert also recognizes Einon and notches a METAL-PIERCIN ARROW. As he tautly, tensely pulls back the bow, he is grimly aware for the first time of the full power of his remarkable talent. But though his conscience wavers, his bow-arm does not.
Thou...shalt...not...kill... He lets fly.

The arrow strikes true. Einon jerks in his saddle as the arrow pierces his mail a imbeds deep in his heart! Staggered by the impact, he suc in his breath. But he does not fall. He doesn't even feel the pain.
EINON'S CASTLE...where Draco suddenly recoils in mid-air grasping his chest, howls in real pain, no scam this time
With devastating skill, both Kara and Bowen dispatch thei enemies. For both have witnessed all... Einon taking the arrow, Draco's screech of pain and fall.
Draco!

EINON...still alive, also watching the Dragon spiral and flutter down. He looks at the arrow in his breast and, hi eyes glinting with understanding, calmly pulls it from hi chest and smiles at its bloody tip.
As the pain-wracked Draco flutters into range, Uhlric springs the catapult. NETS OF IRON MESH shoot out.  97
Einon sees the Iron Nets enfold the dragon as he topples behind the castle walls with a groan. Realizing, what thi means, Einon spurs his horse toward the castle gates.
The Dragonslayers! Noooo! He rides hell-bent for leather as...
Nooo!

With an anguished shout, Bowen tears down the hill for Ei Kara watches his furious, futile chase and exchanges a worried glance with Gilbert, who rushes up to her. They b look to Bowen who has given up his chase. He turns to the his face a mask of anguished determination.

The remaining dragonslayers...Uhlric, Odolf, and Oram... netted the limp form of Draco. He lies still and quiet, several of his horns are broken off. The Dragonslayers mo in cautiously, when Draco suddenly shifts on his side, moaning, clutching his chest. Ulhric and the brothers swarm in on the beast. But sudden a wild Einon is upon them, beating them back with his swo
No! I want it alive! Einon grimly leers at the pain-wracked, semi-conscious Dr
Chain it! Bind its wounds! I want it alive...And safe!
(whispered groan) No...

Yes...Safe for all eternity. Fear not, dragon, Bowen will come. A knight of the Old Code does not abandon a comrade-in- arms. He laughs and departs. Draco struggles weakly under the nets. BUT THE CAMERA PANS UP TO...  98 AISLINN...on the battlements...gazing on Draco in solemn concern.

Hewe and the rebels survey the carnage they have wrought. Savouring the taste of victory. Tall and proud. Men once more. As Bowen, Kara, and Gilbert emerge into the forest, Hewe salutes them with an upraised sword and a smile. But his smile vanishes when he sees their long faces.

Einon stands on the battlements, gazing out at the forest -below. It is dotted with THE GLOW OF THE REBEL CAMPFIRES Then reverberating from the castle walls comes A MOURNFUL TRILL. Einon looks down into the courtyard below where Dr is chained.

Draco's MELANCHOLY TRILL echoes from the castle walls out across the night to the forest's edge where camp a dispir group of rebels. CAMERA PANS TO: BOWEN...listening to Draco's sad song in anguish as Gilbe dresses a wound on Kara's shoulder.
Why does he keep him alive! He must be torturing him.
No, Einon will not torture him. He will not harm him in any way. Bowen turns to her, not understanding.
(remembering) "Einon will not fall in my lifetime" ...-Draco's words to me once. I saw him go down. No one touched him. It was when Gilbert shot Einon.
What are you saying?
When my arrow pierced Einon's heart that was when Draco screamed and fell. Bowen stares at them in dumbfounded disbelief, refusing t contemplate what is being suggested.  99
Don't you see? It's the heart. The Dragon's heart. For Einon to die, Draco must die! :
No! No...Gilbert must have missed. (fiercely) It doesn't matter. Nothing matters except that Draco is still alive. Bowen hops up on a stump and shouts to his men.
I go to save the Dragon. Who goes with me? No rush to volunteer. Just muttered oaths and sullen face Bowen turns in disgust to find Kara holding out his sword
You do not go alone.
No...not alone... GILBERT...who plops his helmet on his head. Bowen slides the sword into his scabbard. Hewe and the ot watch in silent shame, as the three march off.

Draco lies heavily chained in a dark courtyard. His back feet and front paws are shackled tightly to the ground, a his tail, allowing almost no movement. His neck and head also chained down to keep him from breathing fire on his restraints. His chin upon the cold stone, he can only loo at the wall straight ahead of him...or out of the corner his eye, where he sees... UHLRIC...on guard, appraising Draco, spitting with distas Then he hears...A FOOTSTEP. Challenging with his spear, Uhlric recognizes a DIM FIGURE in the shadow.
Oh...Come for a peek at the royal pet? Suddenly, Uhlric's eyes widen in surprise. A KNIFE flashe out of the dark in the shadow's hand.

He hears a STRANGLED GASP. Uhlric WEAVES INTO VIEW, grasp his throat. He collapses to the ground. His spear rolls from his lifeless fingers almost to Draco's snout.  100 Out of the corner of his eye, Draco sees the Shadow.
Come from the shadows, Aislinn. Stand where I can see you. Aislinn comes forth. Sheathing her bloodstained dagger. Gazing down on the man she killed. Then at Draco.
You know why I've come?
I know.
A sorry end...
The only end. In giving my heart, I have taken on every pain and poison stirring in his black breast. Even the pain of his death must be mine. Too long I've waited...
(sits by him) No one would blame you...Death without immortality.

That was not the only reason...To rid the world of Einon, would not rid it of evil. I had to wait. Wait for a time when mankind would not repeat my sin and let tyranny thrive. When there would be those who remembered the Once-ways. Remembered that even in the darkness there is still light and those who watch over them...I cannot see. Are the stars shining tonight?
(weeping) Brightly, my lord, brightly.
Then there is light enough. My soul need not flicker above.

It is my sin, Dragon Lord, for a mother's misguided heart, you gambled eternity and lost...Forgive me. Aislinn rises. Picks up Uhlric's spear. It is heavy, but she manages. But suddenly A HAND tears the spear from Aislinn's grasp. Einon's hand!  101
I know why you brought me the dragon- slayers, Mother. You wanted them to kill him. You wanted me dead.
I wanted to correct a mistake made years ago when I saved a creature not worth saving.
How unmotherly of you. His voice is like ice, but Aislinn does not flinch. DRACO...eyes filled with terror, watches...
TWO SHADOWS on the wall, one raising a SHADOW SPEAR to st the other.
No-o-o-o!

Kara leads Gilbert and Bowen to the hole in the wall's ro foundation. As they are about to enter, Draco's wailing lament echoes from inside. The three exchange a worried glance and dart into the passage.
Kara leads Bowen and Gilbert into the cistern from the passageway. Bowen charges for the courtyard door.
Not that way. Too dangerous.
Then that's our way. Bowen and the others wheel around to see... HEWE...and a SMALL BAND OF MEN enter the secret passage.
We've got to open the gates for rest of us waiting outside. Touched by this loyalty, Bowen warmly claps Hewe on shoul
Go save your dragon.  102 He opens the door that leads to the castle grounds and, taking a cautionary peek, motions his men out. Kara point to the other stairwell.

This leads to the castle. We can see the whole courtyard from there. Bowen starts up, but Kara holds him back. Their eyes meet Both know this may be the last quiet moment they share. S tightens her "favour" on his arm.
You carry my favour. Carry this too... She leans up and kisses him. Bowen enfolds her in his arm
The secret passage opens. Bowen, Kara, and Gilbert creep in...only to find Einon comfortably sprawled on the bed.
What a pleasant surprise. I expected you, Knight. But my bride-to-be, as well? And with a priest to wed us.
To bury you, Einon. Blade out, Bowen charges, stabbing only the bedclothes, a Einon whirls off the bed, arrogantly grinning.

Well, to bury one of us! His blade meets Bowen's in mid-air. And the two engage in fast and furious swordplay. The clanging blades attract T GUARDS outside the chamber. Gilbert and Kara intercept th charge as Bowen and Einon duel near the fireplace. Einon good. Very good. Bowen has taught him well. He ducks a slash of Einon's blade and executes an athletic drop-kick against the king that sends him careening down the stairw of the secret passageway. Bowen leaps down after him. Kara, dispatching her guard, begins to follow Bowen and Einon. But Gilbert, the sword not being his weapon, is ha pressed and she goes to his aid instead.

Einon rumbles down the stone steps and slumps lifelessly there. Bowen rushes dwn on the limp form... ---and nearly gets decapitated, as Einon's eyes flick ope and he lunges.  103 Angered, Bowen attacks with a wild sally. Einon, confiden in his invincibility, cooly deflects the blade and forces Bowen back into the cistern.
Practice what you preach, mentor. Purpose, not passion, remember? The jibe only intensifies Bowen's reckless assault.
Nerve cold blue... Taunting, Einon nimbly ducks a vicious swipe, executes a swift thrust that scores a vicious slash across Bowen's c

«.+.Blade blood red. Bowen ducks a vicious thrust and nearly loses his balance the edge of the cistern pool. As he teeters there, Einon takes a savage swipe, but this time it is Bowen who flips away...over the water on the other side of the cistern. E Einon's impressed. He barks a laugh.
Still have a few lessons to teach me, mentor?
Just one more.
What, pray, is that?

The last one your father learned. The wound has renwed Bowen's cool vigor. He is calm and h as he drives Einon up into a dark cistern tunnel. All tha can be seen in the blackness are the blue sparks of the clanging blades.

A cringing FELTON flattensd against a staircase wall. Rap steps descend and Kara appears, gripping her axe, trying decide which way to go. Felton, realizing his enemy is only a woman, sweeps out o the shadows like a spider, his sword at her throat as he leers triumphantly over her shoulder.
This will put me in good with his majesty.  104

I doubt it. A quarterstave crashes down on his head. The lamps go out his eyes and, as his blade slides harmlessly away from Ka he crumples slack-jawed to the ground. Kara wheels to fin Hewe standing over the collapsed Felton.
I'm in your debt.
I'm in yours. Your father would be proud. They continue on their seperate ways.
Einon drives Bowen up a castle stairwell. The knight is hard-pressed, but holding his own.
We know each other's every move. But I'm younger and faster.
I'll slow you so you won't get any older. The duellists fight their way up the stairs.

Kara, axe in hand, whirls onto a battlement through the wreckage of the dragonslayers' catapults. She turns to ge her bearings straight and sees A HUGE SHADOW looming on t wall behind her, hoisting a HUGE SHADOW SWORD.. Kara wheels around to confront Brok, but her axe is no ma for Brok's heavy descending sword. The impact tears the weapon from her hand and sends her careening into the dea dragonslayer, Jugurtha, still impaled on the wall. She snatches THE GIANT AXE still cluthced in his dead han and jerks the heavy shaft with two hands to fend off Brok blade, But the sword slices right through the shaft. The weight the axe jerks Kara to safety. The blade whizzes by her. Brok wheels, Kara swings the butt of the broken axe-pole against Brok's shield, It cracks him under the jaw and throws him off-guard. She twirls the axe, blade up, and thrusts it up between Brok's legs. He crumbles to the ground, devastated.  105
A girl?...a girl? Kara jerks the axe from the corpse.
Like a pudding.

Hewe and his marauders descend upon the guards, slaying t and opening the gate...only to find AN OUTER GATE beyond. Also guarded. Before Hewe's men can cut them down, one SENTRY blows ALARUM on a Ram's horn.
Bowen and Einon ascend the tower steps, blades flashing furiously. They've heard the alarum. Bowen grins.
My rebels are storming your castle.
Pity you won't live to see them fail. Einon's blade nearly slices off an ear. Angered, Bowen manuevers Einon around and proceeds to back him up the stairs.

Hewe and his band are beset by Einon's SOLDIERS as they struggle with the gate. But suddenly, several GUARDS pitc forward,slain by a rapid volley of arrows fired by... GILBERT...Hewe smiles and salutes him with a wave. Then t gates open and, with wild war shouts, the REBELS pour in.

Odolf, in the courtyard, looks to Oram on the parapet. Bo grip their spears in edgy tenseness, reacting to the soun of battle, the fight up the tower, and Draco's writhing agony. His arm GLOWS A THROBBING RED where Bowen cut Eino

Bowen and Einon burst through the door into a half-crumbl TOWER-ROOM. It is roofless, most of it's walls destroyed, open to the elements. Its vantage point gives us a spectacular view of the whole castle and the country beyo And Draco chained in the courtyard below.  106 They duel over and around building materials and scaffold locked in fierce combat. Sparks fly from their clanging blades. Bowen presses Einon hard.

(cold hate) Once you held this sword in a sacred oath, which you broke. Now embrace it again. Bowen swipes a wicked thrust that Einon barely sidesteps. Bowen blade cracks against a piece of masonry. Einon whir in with no mercy. Bowen tosses his broken hilt at Einon a dives into a clutter of scaffolding. Einon chops and hack at it sending splintered chips flying as he tries to fini Bowen off. He laughs in malicious glee, eyes glinting lik “madman.
Fool! You lost before you began. I am immortal! Bowen leaps up, twirling onto a crossbeam, out and over Einon, who spins to cut him down before he lands.

Bowen! Kara has appeared on the roof and throws her axe to Bowen still in mid-air. Catching it, he lands and catches Einon blade on it. Einon is jarred back and Bowen sends the axe flying. It shrieks through the air, just missing Einon's head and burying itself in the heavy wooden shutter of a window in a partially rebuilt wall. still off-balance, Ei strikes. Bowen leaps the thrust and jumps onto the low si to yank his axe free. It won't budge. Einon snarls a laugh and lunges. Bowen pushes off from th sill and, clinging to the axe-handle, rides the shutter a swings out. Einon cannot stop his momentum and he spills of the window into space.

As Einon's body tumbles from the window, crashes through scaffolding, sending building materials as well as himsel careening down on top of and into the cistern in a cacoph of clatter, clutter, and dust.
As Einon along with wreckage, plunges beneath the surface the water.  107
Kara dashes to the window, as Bowen clings to his axe-han on the swinging shutter. Both look down.
Einon has disappeared into the watery depths beneath the wreckage of scaffolding and cistern.
Bowen looks over at Kara.
So much for his immortality. But echoing below comes Draco's AGONIZED GROAN! Bowen cal to the dragon, whose pain-wracked body GLOWS RED TORMENT.
Draco! Just then...the axe gives in the shutter! Then unwedges itself and Bowen falls out into space.
Bowen! But he doesn't go far. He has grabbed hold of a PULLEY-LI that is attached to the tower and is fast spiralling down the courtyard below...and Draco!

Odolf, realizing Einon's dead, wheels on the chained drag and, grinning, utters a war-cry and charges with his spea But he suddenly hears something behind him. It is... BOWEN...riding the pulley~line down and swooping in on Od from behind. Odolf holds up his spear to block the descending axe. But the blade slices through the shaft an buries itself in Odolf's chest. A WAIL OF GRIEF AND OUTRA echoes from... THE BATTLEMENTS...where ORAM, having witnessed his brothe death, pulls his bow string taut. But before he can unlea his arrow, Draco's nostril shoots a SPRAY OF FLAME that engulfs the dragonslayer, the impact knocking him off the parapet with an agonizing scream, as..
«+ehis body, a spiralling fireball, plummets down the wal and down the mountain.  108
Bowen pilfers the keys off Odolf's belt and starts to unl the shackles about Draco's neck. Draco stretches his neck
You should have let them do it. Now you must.
What? Kara arrives in the courtyard from the tower, overhearing Draco.
Even as the heart binds Einon to me in life, it binds us in death.
That is not true.
You've seen that it is. Through the heart we share each other's pains and power. But in my half beats the Life Source. For Einon to die, I must die.
(refusing to believe) Einon is dead! Tell him, Kara! But Kara can't. She is uncertain. She knows what she's seen. But she also knows Draco.
I...1...don't know...
You saw it!
He lives! Bowen is desperate.
It doesn't matter! {gestures to the battle noise) Don't you hear it? Our rebels...our silly, sorry little band of rebels have stormed the castle. Alive or dead, Einon's beaten. We've won!  109
You will never win until Einon's evil is destroyed. And to do that, you must destroy me!
No!

Once you swore your sword and service were mine. To call when I had need of you. To ask what I would of you. I ask now! I need now. I hold you to your vow, Knight! Suddenly Draco's sixth sense picks up something. He wince ‘pain, hissing breathlessly.
He's coming! Coming to stop you! Bowen frantically whirls to the wreckage. But there is nothing. No one.
Strike before it's too late!
(torn) You're the last!
My time is over. Strike!
You're my friend!
Then as my friend, Strike! Please!
I can't! I can't send you soulless into Hell!

(snarling) Then I will make you! With a roar, Draco lunges at Bowen with his snapping fang Bowen evades the blow. Again, Draco lashes out, trying to provoke Bowen, but again the knight dodges the sharp teet

Fight back, Dragonslayer!  110 Once more, Draco dives at him with his flashing fangs. Bo leaps out of the shackled dragon's range. Rattling his chains wildly, Draco shoots a jet of flame at Bowen. Kara screams, but Bowen holds ground, as the flamess just miss
Defend yourself! Bowen flings the axe to the ground, near the wreckage of cistern. Draco shoots another bolt of fire. This one closer. Bowen recoils.
Pick it up! His chest heaves out ready to spew more fire.
No! TI will do it! She runs for the axe. Bowen moves to stop her.

EINON!...suddenly leaping up out of the wreckage of the cistern and scaffolding. Bloody and battered but very muc alive! Draco wails in misery. Einon grabs Kara by the arm and whirls her to him, sword blade at her throat. Bowen snatches up the axe and hoists back, aimed at Draco.

Move and she dies! STALEMATE. Bowen freezes...until... DRACO...viciously sinks his fangs into his chained claw. But it is Einon who FEELS THE FANGS. In his sword hand.
